description.blockchain: The blockchain is becoming more and more present in everyday life because it can create new business dynamics that guaranteed decentralization and transparency.
description.wallet: The wallet represents your identity on the blockchain. It takes advantage of asymmetric cryptography, therefore it is composed of a public key and a private key to each other.
description.the_mnemonic_phrase: The mnemonic phrase is a sequence of words, generally, 12, that allows you to recover your wallet. It must be carefully preserved and kept secret.
description.address: Represents your identifier on the blockchain. Anyone who wants to transfer funds to you or want to interact with you will need to refer to this code. It could be considered your 'IBAN' or your identity card number.

transactionDetail.heading: Transaction
transactionDetail.transaction_confirmed: The transaction has been sent. It will soon be included in a block.

steps.balance: This is your balance. Represents the amount of Ether available in Your Wallet
steps.address: Your wallet address represents your identifier on the blockchain. It's kind of like an IBAN, but with superpowers
steps.registered_addresses: Here you can find the list of Wallet Addresses generated through
steps.send: Click here to send Ether to another Wallet
steps.twitter: Click here to communicate to the world that you finally have a Wallet on Ethereum
steps.etherscan: Click here to see the status of your Wallet on Etherscan, one of the leading blockchain explorers on Ethereum
steps.menu_button_network: Click here to choose between the test network (Polygon Mumbai) and the main network (Mainnet)

wallet_creation.qr_wallet_not_exist: You must first create a wallet
wallet_creation.loading_text: . . . generation of your private key in progress!
wallet_creation.description_address: Hold on tight, buckle up and hit let's go
wallet_creation.description_key: Everything start from the creation of a private key

basic_slide_address.title: This is Your Address
basic_slide_address.description: It represents the identifier of your Wallet on Ethereum, a bit like the IBAN of a bank account

basic_slide_key.title: Here is your private key!
basic_slide_key.heading: Keep it and do not show it to anyone!
basic_slide_key.description: To identify your Wallet on Ethereum (for example to receive transactions) instead use the address calculated from your private key

clear_data.heading: Warning! Wallet data deletion
clear_data.dialog_body_one: Are you sure you want to delete your Wallet data? If you have not made a backup, you will no longer be able to access your wallet.
clear_data.dialog_body_two: If you are sure, enter the following code and press the 'Clear data' button

export.heading: Wallet export
export.password_label: Enter a password to encrypt the wallet before downloading it
export.password_alert: Your wallet will be encrypted using your password

import.title: Import your wallet
import.description: Enter your private key to import your wallet:
import.description_error: The Private key entered is wrong!
